<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Financial Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company reports its
financial results in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (&#147;U.S. GAAP&#148;). However, management believes that also presenting certain <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures
provides additional information to facilitate the comparison of the company&#146;s historical operating results and trends in its underlying operating results, and provides additional transparency on how the company evaluates its business.
Management uses these <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures in making financial, operating and planning decisions and in evaluating the company&#146;s performance. The company also believes that presenting these
measures allows investors to view its performance using the same measures that the company uses in evaluating its financial and business performance and trends. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company considers quantitative and qualitative factors in assessing whether to adjust for the impact of items that may be significant or that could affect
an understanding of its ongoing financial and business performance and trends. The adjustments generally fall within the following categories: acquisition&nbsp;&amp; divestiture activities, gains and losses on intangible asset sales and <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairments, major program restructuring activities, constant currency and related adjustments, major program financing and hedging activities and other major items affecting comparability of operating
results. See below for a description of adjustments to the company&#146;s U.S. GAAP financial measures included herein. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> information should be considered as supplemental in nature and is not meant to be considered in isolation or
as a substitute for the related financial information prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP. In addition, the company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures may not be the same as or comparable to similar <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures presented by other companies. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>DEFINITIONS OF THE COMPANY&#146;S
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">NON-GAAP</FONT> FINANCIAL MEASURES </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial
measures and corresponding metrics reflect how the company evaluates its operating results currently and provide improved comparability of operating results. As new events or circumstances arise, these definitions could change. When these
definitions change, the company provides the updated definitions and presents the related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> historical results on a comparable basis. When items no longer impact the company&#146;s current or future
presentation of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> operating results, the company removes these items from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions. In the first quarter of 2022, the company added to the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions the exclusion of incremental costs due to the war in Ukraine. In the second quarter of 2022, the company added to the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions the exclusion
of costs incurred associated with our publicly-announced processes to sell businesses. In the third quarter of 2022, the company added to the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions the exclusion of inventory <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">step-up</FONT> charges associated with acquisitions. In the fourth quarter of 2022, the company added to the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions the exclusion of the impact from the European
Commission legal matter. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Organic Net Revenue&#148;</B> is defined as net revenues excluding the impacts of acquisitions,
divestitures and currency rate fluctuations. The company also evaluates Organic Net Revenue growth from emerging markets and developed markets. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Adjusted Gross Profit&#148;</B> is defined as gross profit excluding the impacts of the Simplify to Grow
Program; acquisition integration costs; the operating results of divestitures; <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity, forecasted currency and equity method investment
transaction derivative contracts; inventory <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">step-up</FONT> charges; 2017 malware incident net recoveries; and incremental costs due to the war in Ukraine. The company also presents &#147;Adjusted Gross Profit
margin,&#148; which is subject to the same adjustments as Adjusted Gross Profit. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted Gross Profit on a constant currency basis. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Adjusted Operating Income&#148;</B> and <B>&#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income&#148;</B> are defined
as operating income (or segment operating income) excluding the impacts of the items listed in the Adjusted Gross Profit definition as well as gains or losses (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairment charges) on
goodwill and intangible assets; divestiture or acquisition gains or losses, divestiture-related costs, acquisition-related costs, and acquisition integration costs and contingent consideration adjustments; remeasurement of net monetary position;
impacts from resolution of tax matters; the European commission legal matter; impact from pension participation changes; and costs associated with the JDE Peet&#146;s transaction. The company also presents &#147;Adjusted Operating Income
margin&#148; and &#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin,&#148; which are subject to the same adjustments as Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted
Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income on a constant currency basis. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Adjusted EPS&#148;</B> is defined as diluted EPS attributable to Mondel&#275;z International from
continuing operations excluding the impacts of the items listed in the Adjusted Operating Income definition, as well as losses on debt extinguishment and related expenses; gains or losses on interest rate swaps no longer designated as accounting
cash flow hedges due to changed financing and hedging plans; net earnings from divestitures; initial impacts from </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="9%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
enacted tax law changes; and gains or losses on equity method investment transactions. Similarly, within Adjusted EPS, the company&#146;s equity method investment net earnings exclude its
proportionate share of its investees&#146; significant operating and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items. The tax impact of each of the items excluded from the company&#146;s U.S GAAP results was computed based on the facts
and tax assumptions associated with each item, and such impacts have also been excluded from Adjusted EPS. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted EPS on a constant currency basis. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>&#147;Free Cash Flow&#148;</B> is defined as net cash provided by operating activities less capital
expenditures. Free Cash Flow is the company&#146;s primary measure used to monitor its cash flow performance. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">See the attached
schedules for supplemental financial data and corresponding reconciliations of the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures referred to above to the most comparable U.S. GAAP financial measures for the three and twelve
months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022 and December&nbsp;31, 2021. See Items Impacting Comparability of Operating Results below for more information about the items referenced in these definitions that specifically impacted the company&#146;s results.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SEGMENT OPERATING INCOME </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company uses segment
operating income to evaluate segment performance and allocate resources. The company believes it is appropriate to disclose this measure to help investors analyze segment performance and trends. Segment operating income excludes unrealized gains and
losses on hedging activities (which are a component of cost of sales), general corporate expenses (which are a component of selling, general and administrative expenses), amortization of intangibles, gains and losses on divestitures and
acquisition-related costs (which are a component of selling, general and administrative expenses) in all periods presented. The company excludes these items from segment operating income in order to provide better transparency of its segment
operating results. Furthermore, the company centrally manages benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income and interest and other expense, net. Accordingly, the company does not present these items by segment because they
are excluded from the segment profitability measure that management reviews. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>ITEMS IMPACTING COMPARABILITY OF OPERATING RESULTS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The following information is provided to give qualitative and quantitative information related to items impacting comparability of operating results. The
company identifies these based on how management views the company&#146;s business; makes financial, operating and planning decisions; and evaluates the company&#146;s ongoing performance. In addition, the company discloses the impact of changes in
currency exchange rates on the company&#146;s financial results in order to reflect results on a constant currency basis. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Divestitures,
Divestiture-related costs and Gains/(losses) on divestitures </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Divestitures include completed sales of businesses, exits of major product lines upon
completion of a sale or licensing agreement and the partial or full sale of an equity method investment such as KDP or JDE Peet&#146;s (discussed separately below under the gains and losses on equity method investment transactions section). As the
company records its share of KDP and JDE Peet&#146;s ongoing earnings on a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-quarter</FONT> lag basis, any KDP or JDE Peet&#146;s ownership reductions are reflected as divestitures within the company&#146;s <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results the following quarter. Divestiture-related costs, which includes costs for the company&#146;s divestitures as defined above, also includes costs incurred associated with the company&#146;s
publicly-announced processes to sell businesses. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">The company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results include the impacts from 2021 partial
sales of its equity method investment in KDP and the May&nbsp;8, 2022 partial sale of its equity investment in JDE Peet&#146;s as if the sales occurred at the beginning of all periods presented. See the section on gains/losses on equity method
investment transactions below for more information. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">On July&nbsp;7, 2022, the company completed the sale of a business in Argentina including several local gum and
candy brands and a manufacturing facility. In addition, the company&#146;s Kraft Heinz Company license agreement to produce and sell Kraft mayonnaise in Latin America countries, predominately Mexico, expired on September&nbsp;1, 2022. The
divestitures of these businesses resulted in a year-over-year reduction in net revenues of $21&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. In addition, the company incurred divestiture-related costs of $3&nbsp;million in the
twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">In 2022, the company announced its intention to divest the company&#146;s developed market gum and global
<I>Halls</I> businesses and in Q4 2022, the company announced an agreement to sell the developed market gum business with an anticipated closing of Q4 2023, subject to relevant antitrust approvals and closing conditions. In addition, the company
incurred divestiture-related costs of $6&nbsp;million in the three months and $15&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">On November&nbsp;1, 2021, the company completed the sale of MaxFoods Pty Ltd, an Australian packaged seafood
business that it had acquired as part of its acquisition of Gourmet Food Holdings Pty Ltd (&#147;Gourmet Food&#148;). The sales price was $57&nbsp;million Australian dollars ($41 million), net of cash divested with the business, and the company
recorded an immaterial loss on the transaction. The divestiture of this business resulted in a year-over-year decline in net revenues of $5&nbsp;million in the three months and $35&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Acquisitions, Acquisition-related costs and Acquisition integration costs and contingent consideration adjustments </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Acquisition-related costs, which includes transaction costs such as third party advisor, investment banking and legal fees, also includes <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> compensation expense related to the buyout of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-vested</FONT> employee stock ownership plan shares and realized gains or losses from hedging activities associated with
acquisition funds. Acquisition integration costs and contingent consideration adjustments include <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> costs related to the integration of acquisitions as well as any adjustments made to the fair market
value of contingent compensation liabilities that have been previously booked for earn-outs related to acquisitions that do not relate to employee compensation expense. The company excludes these items to better facilitate comparisons of its
underlying operating performance across periods. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On November&nbsp;1, 2022, the company acquired Grupo Bimbo&#146;s confectionery business, Ricolino,
located primarily in Mexico.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The acquisition of Ricolino builds on our continued prioritization of fast-growing snacking segments in key geographies. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $105&nbsp;million during
the three months and twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022, and operating income of $1&nbsp;million during the three months and twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. In addition, the company incurred acquisition integration costs of
$4&nbsp;million in the three months and $11&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022 and an inventory <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">step-up</FONT> charge of $5&nbsp;million in the three and twelve months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2022. The company also recorded several items within acquisition-related costs that resulted in income of $64&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022, as realized gains related to hedging contracts associated
with acquisition funds more than offset other acquisition transaction costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On August&nbsp;1, 2022, the company acquired 100% of the equity of Clif
Bar&nbsp;&amp; Company (&#147;Clif Bar&#148;), a leading U.S. maker of nutritious energy bars with organic ingredients. The acquisition expands our global snacks bar business and complements our refrigerated snacking and performance nutrition bar
portfolios. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $204&nbsp;million during the three months and $361&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31,2022, and operating income of $10&nbsp;million during the three months and
$13&nbsp;million during the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. In addition, the company incurred an inventory <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">step-up</FONT> charge of $20&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022 and
acquisition integration costs and contingent consideration adjustments of $14&nbsp;million in the three months and $30&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. These acquisition integration costs include an increase to the
contingent consideration liability due to changes to underlying assumptions. The company also incurred acquisition-related costs of $296&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022, primarily related to the buyout of the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-vested</FONT> employee stock ownership plan shares. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On January&nbsp;3, 2022, the company acquired Chipita Global S.A.
(&#147;Chipita&#148;), a leading croissants and baked snacks company in the Central and Eastern European markets. The acquisition of Chipita offers a strategic complement to the company&#146;s existing portfolio and advances its strategy to become
the global leader in broader snacking. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $161&nbsp;million during the three months and $651&nbsp;million during the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022, and an operating loss of $3&nbsp;million
during the three months and operating income of $36&nbsp;million during the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. The company incurred acquisition-related costs of $1&nbsp;million in the three months and $22&nbsp;million in the twelve months
ended December&nbsp;31, 2022, and $6&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. The company also incurred acquisition integration costs of $5&nbsp;million in the three months and $90&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2022, and $11&nbsp;million in the three months and $17&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;1,
2021, the company acquired Gourmet Food Holdings Pty Ltd, a leading Australian food company in the premium biscuit and cracker category. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $14&nbsp;million and operating income of $1&nbsp;million
during the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. The company incurred acquisition integration costs of $1&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. The company also incurred acquisition-related costs of $1&nbsp;million in
the three months and $8&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;25, 2021, the company acquired a majority interest
in Lion/Gemstone Topco Ltd (&#147;Grenade&#148;), a performance nutrition leader in the United Kingdom. The acquisition of Grenade expands the company&#146;s position into the premium nutrition segment. The acquisition added incremental net revenues
of $21&nbsp;million and operating income of $2&nbsp;million during the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. The company incurred acquisition-related costs of $2&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On January&nbsp;4, 2021, the company acquired the remaining 93% of equity of Hu Master Holdings, a category leader in premium chocolate in the United States,
which provides a strategic complement to the company&#146;s snacking portfolio in North America through growth opportunities in chocolate and other offerings in the well-being segment. The initial cash consideration paid
</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
was $229&nbsp;million, net of cash received, and the company may be required to pay additional contingent consideration. The estimated fair value of the contingent consideration obligation at the
acquisition date was $132&nbsp;million and was determined using a Monte Carlo simulation based on forecasted future results. During the third quarter of 2021, the company recorded a $70&nbsp;million reduction to the liability due to changes in the
expected pace of growth. During the third quarter of 2022, the company recorded an additional $7&nbsp;million reduction to the liability due to further changes to forecasted future results. As a result of acquiring the remaining equity interest, the
company consolidated the operation and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $9&nbsp;million ($7&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> related to stepping up the company&#146;s previously-held
$8&nbsp;million (7%) investment to fair value. The company incurred acquisition-related costs of $9&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;1, 2020, the company acquired a majority interest in Give&nbsp;&amp; Go, a North American leader in fully-finished sweet baked goods and owner
of the famous&nbsp;two-bite<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">&reg;</SUP>&nbsp;brand of brownies and the Create-A-Treat<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">&reg;</SUP>&nbsp;brand, known for cookie and gingerbread house
decorating kits. The acquisition of Give &amp; Go provides access to the in-store bakery channel and expands the company&#146;s position in broader snacking. The company incurred acquisition integration costs and contingent consideration adjustments
of $25 million in the three months and $26 million in the twelve months ended December 31, 2022, primarily related to an increase to the contingent consideration liability due to changes to forecasted future results. The company also incurred
acquisition integration costs of $3 million in the three months and $6 million in the twelve months ended December 31, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Simplify to Grow
Program </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The primary objective of the Simplify to Grow Program is to reduce the company&#146;s operating cost structure in both its supply chain
and overhead costs. The program covers severance as well as asset disposals and other manufacturing and procurement-related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> costs. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Restructuring costs </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded restructuring
charges of $28&nbsp;million in the three months and $36&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. The company recorded a net credit within restructuring costs of $96&nbsp;million, due to gains on sale of assets, primarily real
estate, included in the restructuring program in the three months ended and recorded restructuring charges of $154&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021 This activity was recorded within asset impairment and exit costs and
benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income. These charges were for severance and related costs, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> asset write-downs (including accelerated depreciation and asset
impairments) and other adjustments, including any gains on sale of restructuring program assets. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Implementation costs </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Implementation costs primarily relate to reorganizing the company&#146;s operations and facilities in connection with its supply chain reinvention program and
other identified productivity and cost saving initiatives. The costs include incremental expenses related to the closure of facilities, costs to terminate certain contracts and the simplification of the company&#146;s information systems. The
company recorded implementation costs of $25&nbsp;million in the three months and $87&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022 and $35&nbsp;million in the three months and $167&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Intangible asset impairment charges </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the company&#146;s 2022 annual testing of indefinite-life intangible assets, the company recorded a $23&nbsp;million intangible asset impairment charge
in the third quarter of 2022 in AMEA related to one biscuit brand. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the first quarter of 2022, the company recorded a $78&nbsp;million intangible
asset impairment charge in AMEA related to one local biscuit brand sold in select markets in AMEA and Europe. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the second quarter of 2021, the
company recorded a $32&nbsp;million intangible asset impairment charge in North America related to one biscuit brand. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and currency derivative contracts </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company excludes unrealized gains and losses <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts) from
outstanding commodity and forecasted currency and equity method investment transaction derivative contracts from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures. The <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts of commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives are excluded until such time that the related exposures impact the company&#146;s operating results. Since the company
purchases commodity and forecasted currency transaction contracts to mitigate price volatility primarily for inventory requirements in future periods, the company makes this adjustment to remove the volatility of these future inventory purchases on
current operating results to facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating performance across periods. The company excludes equity method investment derivative contract settlements as they represent protection of value for future divestitures.
The company recorded net unrealized losses on commodity, forecasted currency and equity method transaction derivatives of $98&nbsp;million in the three months and $318&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022, and recorded net
unrealized gains of $9&nbsp;million in the three months and $277&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Remeasurement of net monetary position </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company translates the results of operations of its subsidiaries from multiple currencies using average exchange rates during each period and translate
balance sheet accounts using exchange rates at the end of each period. The company records currency translation adjustments as a component of equity (except for highly inflationary currencies) and realized exchange gains and losses on transactions
in earnings. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Highly inflationary accounting is triggered when a country&#146;s three-year cumulative inflation rate exceeds 100%. It requires the
remeasurement of financial statements of subsidiaries in the country, from the functional currency of the subsidiary to our U.S. dollar reporting currency, with currency remeasurement gains or losses recorded in earnings. At this time, within the
company&#146;s consolidated entities, Argentina and T&uuml;rkiye<I> </I>are accounted for as highly inflationary economies. For Argentina, the company recorded remeasurement losses of $12&nbsp;million in the three months and $39&nbsp;million in the
twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022 and $3&nbsp;million in the three months and $13&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021 related to the revaluation of the Argentinean peso denominated net monetary position over these
periods. For T&uuml;rkiye, the company recorded remeasurement losses of $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $1&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022 related to the revaluation of the Turkish lira denominated net monetary
position over these periods. The company recorded these charges for Argentina and T&uuml;rkiye within selling, general and administrative expenses. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Impact from pension participation changes </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The
impact from pension participation changes represent the charges incurred when employee groups are withdrawn from multiemployer pension plans and other changes in employee group pension plan participation. The company excludes these charges from its <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results because those amounts do not reflect the company&#146;s ongoing pension obligations. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the second
quarter of 2021, the company made a decision to freeze its Defined Benefit Pension Scheme in the United Kingdom. As a result, the company recognized a curtailment credit of $17&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021 recorded
within benefit plan <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-service</FONT> income. In addition, the company incurred incentive payment charges and other expenses related to this decision of $1&nbsp;million in the three months and $48&nbsp;million in
the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021 included in operating income. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;11, 2019, the company received an undiscounted withdrawal
liability assessment related to the company&#146;s complete </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">withdrawal from the Bakery and Confectionery Union and Industry International Pension Fund
totaling $526&nbsp;million and requiring <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pro-rata</FONT> monthly payments over 20 years. The company began making monthly payments during the third quarter of 2019. In connection with the discounted long-term
liability, the company recorded accreted interest of $3&nbsp;million in the three months and $11&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022 and $3&nbsp;million in the three months and $11&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2021 within interest and other expense, net. As of December&nbsp;31, 2022, the remaining discounted withdrawal liability was $344&nbsp;million, with $15&nbsp;million recorded in other current liabilities and $329&nbsp;million
recorded in long-term other liabilities. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Incremental costs due to the war in Ukraine </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In February 2022, Russia began a military invasion of Ukraine and the company closed its operations and facilities in Ukraine. In March 2022, the
company&#146;s two Ukrainian manufacturing facilities in Trostyanets and Vyshhorod were significantly damaged. During the first quarter of 2022, the company evaluated and impaired these and other assets. The company recorded $143&nbsp;million of
total expenses ($145&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> incurred as a direct result of the war, including $75&nbsp;million recorded in asset impairment and exit costs, $44&nbsp;million in cost of sales and
$24&nbsp;million in selling, general and administrative expenses. During the remainder of 2022, the company reversed approximately $22&nbsp;million of previously recorded charges primarily as a result of higher than expected collection of trade
receivables and inventory recoveries. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>European Commission legal matter </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In November 2019, the European Commission informed the company that it initiated an investigation into the company&#146;s alleged infringement of European
Union competition law through certain practices allegedly restricting cross-border trade within the European Economic Area. On January&nbsp;28, 2021, the European Commission announced it had taken the next procedural step in its investigation and
opened formal proceedings. The company has been cooperating with the investigation and is currently engaged in discussions with the European Commission in an effort to reach a negotiated, proportionate resolution to this matter. As of
December&nbsp;31, 2022, the company recorded an accrual in accordance with U.S. GAAP of &#128;300&nbsp;million ($318 million) as an estimate of the possible cost to resolve this matter. There is a possibility that the final liability could be
materially higher than the amount accrued. Due to the inherent uncertainty of the discussions and possible outcomes, any possible loss or range of loss different from the amount accrued is not reasonably estimable at this time. Due to the unique
nature of this matter, the company believes it to be infrequent and unusual and therefore exclude it to better facilitate comparisons of the company&#146;s underlying operating performance across periods. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;18, 2022, the company completed a tender offer and redeemed long-term U.S. dollar denominated notes totaling $987&nbsp;million. The company
recorded a $129&nbsp;million loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses within interest and other expense, net, consisting of $38&nbsp;million paid in excess of carrying value of the debt and from recognizing unamortized discounts and deferred
financing costs in earnings and $91&nbsp;million in unamortized forward starting swap losses in earnings at the time of the debt extinguishment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On
March&nbsp;31, 2021, the company completed an early redemption of euro (&#128;1,200 million) and U.S. dollar ($992 million) denominated notes. The company recorded a $137&nbsp;million loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses within interest
and other expense, net, consisting of $110&nbsp;million paid in excess of carrying value of the debt and from recognizing unamortized discounts and deferred financing costs in earnings and $27&nbsp;million foreign currency derivative loss related to
the redemption payment at the time of the debt extinguishment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Initial impacts from enacted tax law changes </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company excludes initial impacts from enacted tax law changes from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures as they do not
reflect its ongoing tax obligations under the enacted tax law changes. Initial impacts include items such as the remeasurement of deferred tax balances and the transition tax from the 2017 U.S. tax reform. Previously, the company only excluded the
initial impacts from more material tax reforms, specifically the impacts of the 2019 Swiss tax reform and 2017 U.S. tax reform. To facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating results, the company has recast all
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">historical&nbsp;non-GAAP&nbsp;earnings</FONT> measures to exclude the&nbsp;initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded a net tax benefit from the decrease of its deferred tax liabilities resulting from enacted tax legislation of $5&nbsp;million in the
three months and a net tax expense from the increase of its deferred tax liabilities of $17&nbsp;million in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2022. The company recorded a net tax expense from an increase of its deferred tax liabilities
resulting from enacted tax legislation of $5&nbsp;million in the three months and $100&nbsp;million (mainly in the United Kingdom) in the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Gains and losses on equity method investment transactions </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>JDE Peet&#146;s transaction </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On May&nbsp;8, 2022, the
company sold approximately 18.6&nbsp;million of our JDE Peet&#146;s shares back to JDE Peet&#146;s, which reduced our ownership interest by approximately 3% to 19.8%. The company received &#128;500&nbsp;million ($529 million) of proceeds and
recorded a loss of &#128;8&nbsp;million ($8 million) on this sale during the second quarter of 2022. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Keurig Dr Pepper transactions </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On August&nbsp;2, 2021, the company sold approximately 14.7&nbsp;million shares of KDP, which reduced its ownership interest by 1% to 5.3% of the total
outstanding shares. The company received $500&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $248&nbsp;million (or $189&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the third
quarter of 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On June&nbsp;7, 2021, the company participated in a secondary offering of KDP shares and sold approximately 28&nbsp;million shares,
which reduced its ownership interest by 2% to 6.4% of the total outstanding shares. The company received $997&nbsp;million of proceeds and recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $520&nbsp;million (or $392&nbsp;million <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> during the second quarter of 2021. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company considers these ownership reductions partial divestitures of
its equity method investment in KDP. Therefore, the company has removed the equity method investment net earnings related to the divested portion from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial results for Adjusted EPS for all
historical periods presented to facilitate comparison of results. The company&#146;s U.S. GAAP results, which include its equity method investment net earnings from KDP, did not change from what was previously reported. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Equity method investee items </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Within Adjusted EPS,
the company&#146;s equity method investment net earnings exclude its proportionate share of its equity method investees&#146; significant operating and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items, such as acquisition and
divestiture-related costs, restructuring program costs and initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Constant currency </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Management evaluates the operating performance of the company and its international subsidiaries on a constant currency basis. The company determines its
constant currency operating results by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the current period local currency operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate the company&#146;s financial statements in the comparable prior-year
period to determine what the current-period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the currency exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior-year period. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>OUTLOOK </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company&#146;s outlook for 2023 Organic Net Revenue growth, Adjusted EPS growth on a constant currency basis and Free Cash Flow are <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures that exclude or otherwise adjust for items impacting comparability of financial results such as the impact of changes in currency exchange rates, restructuring activities, acquisitions
and divestitures. The company is not able to reconcile its projected Organic Net Revenue growth to its projected reported net revenue growth for the full-year 2023 because the company is unable to predict during this period the impact from potential
acquisitions or divestitures, as well as the impact of currency translation due to the unpredictability of future changes in currency exchange rates, which could be material as a significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the
U.S. The company is not able to reconcile its projected Adjusted EPS growth on a constant currency basis to its projected reported diluted EPS growth for the full-year 2023 because the company is unable to predict during this period the timing of
its restructuring program costs, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts and impacts from potential acquisitions
or divestitures as well as the impact of currency translation due to the unpredictability of future changes in currency exchange rates, which could be material as a significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the U.S. The
company is not able to reconcile its projected Free Cash Flow to its projected net cash from operating activities for the full-year 2023 because the company is unable to predict during this period the timing and amount of capital expenditures
impacting cash flow. Therefore, because of the uncertainty and variability of the nature and amount of future adjustments, which could be significant, the company is unable to provide a reconciliation of these measures without unreasonable effort.
</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 4a </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Net Revenues </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(in
millions of U.S. dollars) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Diluted Average Shares Outstanding</B></P></TD>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><B>1,413</B></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>&nbsp;</B></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">Taxes were computed for each of the items excluded from the company&#146;s GAAP results based on the facts and
tax assumptions associated with each item. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Adjusted (Non-GAAP)</B></P></TD>

<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
